channel.title: Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT
channel.description: Recent content in Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT

item.title: CISSOS - Getting started with the Open IoT Challenge!
item.description: Two months have passed since we handed in our topic for the Open IoT Challenge and now we (finally!) want to give an introduction to our project and what we want to (and have already) achieve(d).

item.title: Protocol Layers of ActivIoTy
item.description: ActivIoTy is based on recognized standard protocols. Since the platform is designed to allow different and heterogeneous devices and implementations, standard technologies are crucial for scalability, enhancement of the system, and also to preserve integrity of data.

item.title: Trync - Setup development environment for ESP32 - Part 2
item.description: In the first part we have already setup and configured ESP-IDF. So let’s do the code, compile and flash with an IDE. I have choose Eclipse IDE which is my favorite for a long time for Java, Atmel AVR and now ESP32 developments.

item.title: ActivIoTy Components
item.description: Checkpoints and Controller: these are the main pieces of ActivIoTy.

item.title: Trync - Setup development environment for ESP32 - Part 1
item.description: For Trync hardware development the key component (Trync agent or Trync-a in short) is ESP32 SoC microcontroller by Espressif.

item.title: Hardware solutions for Eclipse IOT Challenge: Exploring LoRa/LoRaWAN
item.description: The Open IoT challenge lead me to research more in depth different technologies both from the hardware and the software aspect.

item.title: ActivIoTy at a Glance
item.description: ActivIoTy is a project, part of the Eclipse Open IoT Challenge 4.0 aiming at enhancing sports timekeeping systems, through IoT low-cost devices.

item.title: Cloud Oscilloscope - Meet the team
item.description: Happy New Year! I would like to take an opportunity and introduce our team.

item.title: ActivIoTy - Sports Timekeeping + IoT for Eclipse Challenge
item.description: To make running attractive among runners there are two important aspects to take into account: accurate/official timekeeping, and publication of comparable results for statistics and competition.

item.title: Cloud Oscilloscope - Top 12
item.description: We have became a TOP-12 Proposal at Eclipse Open IoT Challenge! Thanks to everyone who believed in us.

item.title: little brother - Update
item.description: “little brother” runs in two language VM’s on the Raspberry PI. The first, Pharo, I’ve discussed at some length. The second I haven’t, partly because it’s better known, but partly because the use case has become clearer during development. It is the Java VM, specifically used with OSGi in the form of Eclipse Kura.

item.title: Autonomy of Things
item.description: Introducing an approach to create IoT solutions that base their functionality on momentarly available devices and resources, and do not rely on a fixed cloud provider.

item.title: Cloud Oscilloscope - Update 1
item.description: Recently we’ve improved qt program on orange pi, now we can handle and show correct signal on display.

item.title: Solar Logger - Overview
item.description: This Graphic gives an technical Overview to the Solar Data Logger Project.
